comments.author: FinneysTrueVision
comments.body: SMS based 2 factor authorization is not considered secure, especially for financial use cases. If you just need a phone number for registering then stealths.net will let you rent a Ukranian virtual phone number for 1 year. Keep in mind that any website or app that offers virtual phone numbers can probably read the messages you are receiving so I would suggest activating a different 2FA method that isn’t SMS.

comments.author: kotajikikox
comments.body: Quote from: Filippo Spina on May 17, 2024, 06:51:47 PMAnything out there that a law-abiding citizen can use to acquire an international phone number in an easy way? Best if it's related to bitcoin, or bitcoin themed of course.Is there a specific country you would like access to? Because as far as I know there are different regulations in different regions even if you are in the same continent. I personally am not aware of any phones that could lead you to having phone international numbers directly. It would have to be a software that you download on your phone. There is also no bitcoin themed phone unless you turn it into one. Buy a whole different phone and download the needed apps for what you want to do.

comments.author: btcinfo891
comments.body: Quote from: Filippo Spina on May 17, 2024, 05:21:06 PMI need a way to acquire an international number so I can use 2FA across various Bitcoin/Crypto platforms. For example, I cannot use YouHodler because I live in U.S.Just google for buy european did number with crypto and you will find a bunch of companies providing phone numbers. You also probably want to get a number with SMS, because not all companies provide authentication codes via voice calls, some insist on sending you an SMS.I cannot recommend a specific company, because I don't use a European VOIP number, but you can probably try a few until you find a suitable one. Also keep in mind that some websites recognize VOIP numbers and refuse to create accounts with such numbers.
